topic: How to containerize event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing Event-Driven Systems using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create, test, and deploy an event-driven system using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, along with Docker for containerization.
key_points: Understanding FastAPI: A high-performance, modern web framework for building APIs in Python.
Setting up the development environment: Prerequisites and installation steps for Python 3.12+, FastAPI, and Docker.
Building an event-driven FastAPI application with example code demonstrating event handling, event publishers/subscribers, and asynchronous processing.
Creating a Dockerfile to containerize the FastAPI app for easy deployment and portability.
Testing the containerized FastAPI application locally using Docker Compose.
Deploying the containerized FastAPI application to various platforms such as AWS Fargate, Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), or Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi uvicorn[standard] aiopubsub
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80"]

version_notes: This guide is tailored to Python 3.12+ and may not be fully compatible with earlier versions.
FastAPI requires at least version 0.65, while aiopubsub requires version 21.3 or later.
caveats: Ensure you have the necessary permissions to run Docker and deploy containerized applications on your target platform.
Adjust the network configuration for production deployment as needed to allow communication between services in a secure manner.
Optimize the FastAPI application for performance by following best practices such as using async functions, caching, and minimizing HTTP requests.
